availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry L. Leigh (Crittenden County, Kentucky, physician.)

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, physician. South Caorlina native. Married to Elizabeth McKane Leigh in Livingston County, Kentucky on March 23, 1848. Father to James R. McKane, W. J. McKane. Physician in Livingston County, Kentucky in 1850. Physician in Crittenden County, Kentucky in 1860. Employed step-son James R. McKane as a clerk in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston, Livingston, p. 361B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky,Crittenden, District 1, p. 483.
Find A Grave, "Henry L. Leigh (1821-1870)," Memorial #54191507, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/54191507 (accessed April 23, 2019).
Federal Mortality Census Schedules, 1850-1880, NARA Collection T655, Roll No. 15, Princeton, Caldwell, Kentucky, 1870, p. 179. (accessed via ancestry.com)
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Livingston County Marriages, Film 000318176, p. 72.
